intro: Gongronema wrayi, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species known for their stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Gongronema wrayi is notable for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
